item.title: Ingredients for an Excellent Day
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1691" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Advertise2win on Flickr"][/caption]

I've been trying to find a way to have consistently awesome days, and after much trial and error (most of it documented on this blog), I've come up with the following list of activities that seem to contribute to days worth having. The elements are pretty open-ended, and allow for multiple interpretations or ways of meeting the requirements, but they help me make sure I cover all the important bases.

item.title: How to Make Your Own Good Days
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1540" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Mana_benz on Flickr"][/caption]

Last week, I had a terrible Wednesday. On that day, I did poorly on a workout I was confident I could do well in. I had to leave Kenpo early because I was so exhausted and beat up, and when I got home, I had a stomach ache. I started panicking about how hungry I was because I thought if I ate food so late I would not be able to sleep, and I was already exhausted. My mom and girlfriend can attest to how immature I was.

The next day was totally different. It was sunny, for one, and I made sure to get enough sleep. Even though traffic kept me from making some appointments, I brushed it off and wore a smile all day long. I had a great time chaperoning my 7th and 8th grade cross country team, and ended the day tired but not exhausted.
